artist: Artist: Wenceslaus Hollar; Artist: After a follower of Hans Holbein the Younger
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: dais or coffin outside of cave with small group of men seated around it; remnants of pudding and bread are on the table; two men at L with long spears full of fish and sausages, with a woman at far L holding a plate with a turkey; a cartouche of Jesus at top center with light beams, looking down at scene; two figures lying on ground in front of coffin
inscription:
Inscription

inscribed in plate at bottom: [The Souldiers by his Sepulcher do feast, / Attir\'d like Monkes, their meate by Nunnes is drest, / Fish and hogges-puddings, some provide, the other, / In Sack and Claret drinke to one another]

numbered in plate at lower right: [16]
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: The Resurrection of Christ, From the Satirical Passion
